description:
There are a lot of basic functions in complex apps that don’t require you to open them fully. In the last decade or so, dynamic notifications have been a solution to this, both on desktops and smartphones. But what about stuff in the middle ground, stuff that’s a little too complex for a notification, but still not crying out for a full app launch? Microsoft thinks it has the answer with some new Office tools.

“Microsoft 365 companions” is the official name for these tools, continuing the company’s long-running tradition of horrible branding. But these mini-apps that live in the taskbar might be a lot more appealing than their nomenclature, at least to the right kind of user.

During the beta, these mini-
title: Office 365 gets new ‘companion apps’ that live in the Windows taskbar

description:
It’s been a year since we saw a new graphics card festooned in Noctua’s iconic shades of brown. But for those who’ve been waiting for an RTX 50-series upgrade, it’s almost here. The official “Noctua Edition” of the Asus GeForce RTX 5080 has been exhaustively detailed in a new video. There are only two details missing: a price and a date.

The new RTX 5080 version of the Asus-Noctua teamup, now entering its third generation, is a little more buttoned-down than the previous ones. The oversized triple-fan cooler has just a bit of extra adornment with one chevron and some ever-so-slight ring decorations on either side. (It’s giving me owl vibes, obviously.)

If you’re wondering, those fans are Noctua NF-A12x25 G2 fans, 25mm wide each. T
title: The Asus-Noctua RTX 5080 teamup is big, modest, and likely pricey

description:
If you’re one of the many users who want to upgrade to Windows 11 but aren’t eligible due to outdated hardware, then you might be familiar with a free tool called Flyby11. That nifty little app lets you bypass the hardware check and install Windows 11 on older Windows 10 PCs that are incompatible and unsupported.

As of this past weekend, Flyby11 now goes by a new name: Flyoobe (pronounced “fly-oh-bee”). Flyoobe contains everything that made Flyby11 great in the first place, but also introduces new features that expand its capabilities and allows you to customize the Windows “Out-of-Box Experience” (OOBE,
title: This free tool installs Windows 11 on any PC without any bloatware

description:
Here’s a conundrum our household of Philadelphia Eagles fans has frequently faced: how to watch an Eagles matchup on ESPN’s Monday Night Football without cable or a live streaming TV subscription. 

Sure, you can try to snag a seven-day free trial of one streaming service or another (we blew through those already). Or maybe MNF is on ABC that week—or not. Then there’s ESPN’s upcoming streaming service, which will cost $40 for a month’s subscription. Or—gulp—you can pay even more for a live streaming TV service like Hulu + Live TV or YouTube TV. 

Personally, I’ve always longed for something like a game pass or a day pass—a discounted, short-term subscription for those times when there’s a Monday Night Football game that we can’t watch any other way.  

Well, Sling just rolled out something along those lines: a
title: Sling’s new Day Pass gets you 24 hours of ESPN and more for $5

description:
If you’ve been looking for a fantastic deal on a solid budget laptop, this is it. Let your fingers do the walking over to eBay, where the official Acer store is offering a refurbished 15-inch model with 16GB of RAM and a 1TB SSD for just $234.59. That’s over 50% off the retail price.

The Acer Aspire 3 is definitely a budget design, with a somewhat outdated AMD 7520U quad-core processor. It’s not going to be a benchmark monster, as it’s comparable to the least-expensive Intel Core i3 chips. Even the integrated graphics—normally a highlight of AMD designs—didn’t wow us in our Acer Aspire 3 review. But the build quality is solid, plus 16GB of DDR5 RAM and a 1TB SSD are generous even at the original price, unheard of at
title: This budget Acer laptop with 16GB RAM is absurdly cheap: $235

description:
The SK Hynix Tube T31 is easily one of our favorite portable SSDs that we’ve tested, not only because it’s fast but because it could easily pass for a USB flash drive. But don’t be fooled—it’s better than your typical USB flash drive, and right now you can get this 1TB drive for $60 instead of its usual $80. That’s its best-ever price!

Back when we reviewed the SK Hynix Tube T31, we were impressed enough to give it a 4.5-star rating. Its compact form factor was one of our favorite things about it, but we also couldn’t deny just how fast it is, able to reach up to 1,000 MB/s transfer speeds.

This super-fast portable SSD will move files in a blink, and it’s more than capable of hitting those numbe
title: We love this tiny SSD that looks like a flash drive! It’s only $60 right now

description:
When’s the last time you saw an amazing laptop deal? I’m talking about a cutting-edge machine with a huge discount, the kind you can’t pass up because you know it’ll be a while before it comes around again—like this Asus TUF F16 with a next-gen RTX 5060 that’s currently on sale with a massive $500 discount at B&H. No word of a lie, this $1,900 gaming fiend is now just $1,400 for a limited time.

The Asus TUF F16 is a proper gaming laptop. For starters, it has a spacious 16-inch IPS display for beautiful colors and wide viewing angles, complete with a crisp 2560×1600 resolution and a fast 165Hz refresh rate for smooth high-frame-rate visuals. Powered by Nvidia’s latest GeForce RTX 5060, this is an ideal laptop for gamers—and yo
title: Asus’ RTX 5060 gaming laptop with 32GB RAM is an insane $500 off

description:

  • Uses common VHDX containers
  • Backs up your system, user libraries, and internal drives

Cons

Our Verdict

While Backup and Resto
title: Backup and Restore (Windows 7) review: Good for imaging, bad for disaster recovery

description:
Wyze rolled out the Duo Cam Pan today, a smart security camera that pairs dual 2K lenses with pan-and-tilt motion tracking to reduce blind spots. Designed for both indoor and outdoor use, it can sweep an area or lock on a subject while keeping the full scene in view.

The Duo Cam Pan’s two lenses work together to cover more ground, either watching adjacent areas or splitting duties so one tracks movement while the other holds a fixed view. It’s built for corner mounting, making it well-suited for porches and exterior walls. A compact form and IP65 weather resistance let it handle indoor rooms or exposed outdoor spots, while reducing the need for multiple devices or lengthy installations.
title: Wyze Duo Cam Pan promises to eliminate blind spots
